intro: Helwingia himalaica var. gracilipes, commonly known as the slender helwingia, is a rare and delicate shrub native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by small, oval-shaped berries. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas at elevations above 2,500 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
